creator: timothyreaves@westfieldgrp.com
text:
In the ThreadGroup, a pacing attribute would specify the amount of time to wait between 
interations.  So if I have a Pace time of 300 (seconds), when the loop finishes, it would wait that 
amount of time before starting to go through again.

This allows time for back end process to 
finish before the next iteration starts.  If you are running a test against a page that starts a job 
on the server, the web page will report that the job has started before the job actually finishes 
running.  Without paceing, the back end can be overloaded with running jobs.

Timers can probably fulfill most of this.  However, in bug #5421, there is a 
suggestion for more flexible Timer elements, which I plan on implementing for 
JMeter 1.8.  I'm going to set this bug report as a duplicate.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 5421 ***
